definition: familiarity at first sight
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
as/as if/such as
happening/instance/reason/cause/intentional/former/old/friend/therefore/hence/(of people) to die, dead

sentences.english: Liu Mengmei is swept off his feet by the ghost of Du Liniang. A romance unfolds.
sentences.chinese: 柳夢梅與夜訪的杜麗娘一見如故，展開一段人鬼情。

sentences.english: No wonder she wins, for she is all old-shoe charm.
sentences.chinese: 難怪她獲得勝利，因爲她有令人一見如故的魅力。

sentences.english: Even after meeting only once, they felt a kinship.
sentences.chinese: 雖然只是一面之緣，但他們一見如故。

sentences.english: Perhaps we have the fortune, to meet one day. There's no need for any reticence .
sentences.chinese: 也許我們有緣，相逢某一天，一見如故無庸諱言。

sentences.english: To hit it off does not mean that you and the other person are in love. At least not yet!
sentences.chinese: 一見如故並不意味着兩人陷入愛情，至少現在還沒有。

sentences.english: We hit it off and became good friends.
sentences.chinese: 我們一見如故，成了好朋友。

sentences.english: I like to visit my neighbor because our two children get along like a house on fire.
sentences.chinese: 我要去拜訪一下鄰居，我們的兩個孩子一見如故。

sentences.english: Fielding was not surprised at the rapidity of their intimacy.
sentences.chinese: 菲爾丁對這種一見如故的樣子並不覺得奇怪。

sentences.english: We know time is not long, but just clicked immediately.
sentences.chinese: 我們認識的時間不長，不過卻一見如故。

sentences.english: When Karen met Jonathan, she immediately felt a connection.
sentences.chinese: 當凱倫遇見強納生時，她馬上感覺到一見如故。

sentences.english: But outside a public telephone stand, she met Song Yusheng, and the two hit it off and began dating.
sentences.chinese: 在大院的公用電話處，她偶遇宋宇生，二人一見如故。

definition: to regret not having met earlier (idiom); It is nice to meet you finally./It feels like we have known each other all along.
love at first sight
close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
variant of 閒談|闲谈[xian2 tan2]
to be kindred spirits/to hit it off
to chat and laugh/to crack jokes/to banter
affectionate/intimate/warmhearted/to get intimate with sb
to chat
(of a couple) to be harmonious/to be each other's sunshine
to talk about everything
to treat each other as an honored guest (idiom)/mutual respect between husband and wife
to forget
a friend in times of tribulations (idiom); a friend in need is a friend indeed
joking matter/to go back on one's words
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
stranger
